subject: Re: [junit] reg. JUnit
msgSnippet: Pallavi, Have a look at the link below. This is an excellent chapter on Junit from the book Java Extreme Programming Cookbook Luckily the chapter on Junit if
messageBody:
Pallavi,

Have a look at the link below. This is an excellent chapter on Junit from the book "Java Extreme Programming Cookbook"

Luckily the chapter on Junit if available for free download

:o-)

http://www.oreilly.com/catalog/jextprockbk/chapter/ch04.pdf

Happy coding !
Vijay Pawar


pallavi metla <pallavi28183@...> wrote:
Hi everybody,

As a part of my Masters, I am supposed to learn JUnit. I went through some of the basic papers as JUnit Test Infected, junit cook book etc. but am not understanding the correct use of that.

Like if I create a simple program like addition of two integers and want to pass the values of a and b to be some (i.e., generating the test cases), how can I do using the JUnit. I created a JUnit program "TestAddInt.java "with a testAdd() method in that compared the resultant value of a and b with the expected value but its something like I took the values a and b as ints..TestAddInt.java but am not understanding how to bring the values of the original java program "AddInt.java"??

I am pretty sure that if someone give a simple example, I will learn the rest. So I would be thankful if someone helps me out.

Regards,
Pallavi
